item.title: Report E-2024110209
item.description:
Report E-2024110209

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-14T12:23:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-22
  • City: Greenwood
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) gallons of product released from one (1) 275-gallon plastic tote. Personnel advised that release was due to a packaging failure. Dayton Freight personnel confirmed they cleaned release using Oil Dri absorbent. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110163
item.description:
Report E-2024110163

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-10T12:20:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-17
  • City: ELKHART
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of ethyl methyl Ketone released from one (1) fifty-five (55) gallon metal drum. The release impacted inside trailer floor. Dayton Freight cleaned release using appropriate PPE available on site. Personnel completed cleanup and generated one (1) fifty-five (55) gallon poly drum of waste. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024110243
item.description:
Report X-2024110243

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-08T12:22:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-02
  • City: INDIANAPOLIS
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Nov 2nd a package was found during the Am sort that showed signs of leaking. The package contained UN1760, CORROSIVE LIQUID, N.O.S., 8, II. It appears that the closure was not secured and the chemical leaked out from there. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and is pending disposition from the shipper.

item.title: Report E-2024110087
item.description:
Report E-2024110087

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-08T12:22:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-15
  • City: ELKHART
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed a four and a half (4.5) gallon release of product, it was advised the trailer arrived with the product released. The terminal personnel cleaned release using Oil Dri absorbent. Dayton Freight completed cleanup and generated two (2) ten (10) gallon poly drum of waste, one containing spent absorbent and product. The other contained the damaged can container was placed into a separate 10-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110088
item.description:
Report E-2024110088

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-08T12:22:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-08
  • City: LOWELL
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight Lines personnel observed approximately one (1) pint of Sodium Bromide released from one (1) plastic bucket due to improper handling. The release impacted the concrete dock floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned up the spill using Oil Dri absorbent. Personnel completed cleanup and generated one (1) four (4) gallon plastic drum of waste containing the spilled product and spent absorbents. Dayton Freight also generated one (1) ten (10) gallon plastic drum of waste containing the punctured bucket. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
